title: Large-Scale Micro-Instructional Design for Remote Language Education: Utilizing the TAPPA Process

context.prior_knowledge: Basic experience with online learning tools, general understanding of digital environments, and foundational knowledge of language learning theories (e.g., communicative language teaching)
context.additional_context: A course focused on developing language learning modules and webinars in smartphone-centric, resource-limited environments, emphasizing improvements in reading comprehension, expression, and vocabulary expansion.

learning_goals: Learners can independently develop at least 3 language learning micro-instructional design scenarios using the 5-stage TAPPA process (Target, Accomplishment, Past, Prototype, Artifact).
Through project-based evaluation, learners can create at least 2 integrated reading-writing language learning modules applicable in Web 2.0/3.0 environments.

Learners can identify and apply at least 5 micro-instructional strategies (e.g., vocabulary games, audio feedback, situational expression practice) to enhance engagement for language learners in smartphone-based limited-technology environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
